passage_text: Put them on the bottom of the crock of the slow cooker, turn the heat to high, and cover. Let the pork cook on high while preparing the greens, about 10 minutes. Meanwhile prepare the greens by washing thoroughly, cutting out the center stem, then cutting into 1 pieces. Rinse again and drain well. Add the greens to the slow cooker along with the remaining ingredients. Turn the slow cooker to low and cook 4-6 hours or until the greens are tender and are a gray-green color. Remove the salt pork before serving. If you're in a hurry, the greens may be cooked on high for 3-4 hours; stir every hour or so

Making the world better, one answer at a time. I just finished looking up a slow cooker recipe for whole chicken-cook on high for 4-5 hours, or on low for 6-8 hours. Do not remove the lid for the first two hours to prevent heat loss. Rinse again and drain well. Add the greens to the slow cooker along with the remaining ingredients. Turn the slow cooker to low and cook 4-6 hours or until the greens are tender and are a gray-green color.

You can really add anything you want. Then, I put the lid on, turn the dial to “low,” and cook for 3 hours, which is how long it takes for a single layer of snug chicken breasts to reach 165 degrees F in my slow cooker. The particular slow cooker I own is this 4-Quart Slow Cooker that cost me $18 in April 2013 (it now costs $20). First, you’re going to take a 2-3 lb package of boneless skinless chicken breasts, and snuggle them as evenly as you can into the bottom of your slow cooker: Now, sprinkle the chicken breasts generously with salt: And some black pepper too: Then, you can add whatever seasonings you like.

Cook on low for approximately 3 hours* until the chicken reaches 165F on a digital thermometer. It is now ready to eat and be used in recipes. *You will have to learn the time your slow cooker needs to fully cook through. Mine takes 3 hours. 4. Cover and cook. Place the cover on the slow cooker and turn it on to high for 4 hours or low for 6 to 8 hours. You do not need to add any liquid. Chickens today typically have some solution added, so they rarely need added liquid. At the end of the cooking time, the meat will be tender, practically falling off the bone.

Cook for 6 hours, undisturbed. Remove the chicken from the slow cooker, and pour the accumulated juices into a 2-cup heatproof container. Skim the fat from the top and transfer the liquid to a small saucepan. Dissolve the cornstarch in a small bowl with 2 teaspoons of water and whisk to form a slurry. BUT... 6 hours on high in my slow cooker (Kitchen Aid was too long. The chicken was over-cooked. Next time, I'll do 6 hours on low, or what the other cook below said; on high for 2 hrs and low for 4.

Place the cover on the slow cooker and cook on HIGH for 4 hours or on LOW for 6-8 hours. Carve and serve chicken or shred it for use in another chicken meal. Use the bones and drippings to make homemade chicken stock in the slow cooker. 1  Rinse the thawed chicken and pat dry. 2  Place the chicken in the slow cooker. Place the cover on the slow cooker and turn it on to high for 4 hours or low for 6 to 8 hours. You do not need to add any liquid. Chickens today typically have some solution added, so they rarely need added liquid. At the end of the cooking time, the meat will be tender, practically falling off the bone.

I use frozen chicken breast. Cook them on low for about 5 hours... sometimes more, depending on work. I make a sauce that is flavorful and delicious. I take about 1 c. of orange juice, 1/2 can of chipotle chili (whole then puree it with all the ingredients.), about 1-3 T. of lemon or lime juice. pour 1/4 cup of Chicken broth over the breasts In a seperate bowl combine 1 box of Chicken Stuffing mix with 1 can of condensed cream of chicken soup. Pour this mixture over chicken breasts. Put the lid on and cook for 6-8 hours on low. The stuffing comes out awesome and the chicken stays moist!
